snippet: Evidence exists to suggest that Mitt Romney's advantages in advertising helped him win in Florida - but it is circumstantial, and there are caveats.
abstract: Evidence exists to suggest that Mitt Romney's advantages in advertising helped him win in Florida - but it is circumstantial, and there are caveats.
lead_paragraph: From Jan. 1 to Jan. 25, Mitt Romney and the "super PAC" supporting his campaign broadcast 12,768 advertisements in media markets that include Florida voters. Newt Gingrich and his super PAC ran only 210.

headline.main: Did Romney's Ad Advantage Help in Florida?
